4) Roll with the punches.  Explanation: The English idiom "Roll with the punches" is the most relevant to the Chinese idiom "通权达变". Both convey the idea of adapting to changing circumstances and situations. "Roll with the punches" is a common English idiom that means to accept and deal with difficult or unexpected situations by being flexible and adaptable. It is often used in situations where one needs to adjust to new information or unexpected events. The phrase is thought to have originated from boxing, where a fighter needs to roll with the punches to avoid getting hit. In the context of the Chinese idiom, "通权达变" implies the ability to navigate through complex situations and reach a solution by adapting to the changing circumstances, which is similar to the idea of "Roll with the punches".
